string-array.name: activity_help_questions
string-array.item: What is Privacy Friendly Finance Manager?
How do I manage my income and expenses?
How can I categorize my expenses?
How do i delete an entry i made?

string-array.name: activity_help_answers
string-array.item: The Privacy Friendly Finance Manager is an app to monitor personal income and expenses.

A financial transaction, either income or expense, can be added to your financial history by using the + button in the toolbar. The list of financial transactions appears in the navigation menu and can be called there. Items inside the transaction list can be edited and deleted.

If you go to the menu item "Categories", you can create new categories. When creating a new transaction, you can assign a category to the transaction. The total balance of the categories are displayed under the menu item "Categories".
Privacy Friendly App Finance Manager does not require any permission. It further does not include any tracking mechanisms or advertisement.
Privacy Friendly App Finance Manager does not require any permission.

Any entry in this app, may it be a transaction, a repeating transaction, an account or a category can be deleted by swiping the entry to the left or to the right and then clicking on the appearing red trash bin button.

Accounts can be used to track the money you have in a real bank account in some bank. It is possible to change the balance of the beginning of the month so you don\'t have to add all the small expenses and incomes by hand. In the Account view you get an overview of all transactions you added to the corresponding account.

resources.string: This application belongs to the group of Privacy Friendly Apps developed by Karlsruher Institute for Technology (KIT). Sourcecode licensed under GPLv3. Images copyright KIT and Google Inc.

All generated transactions will be retained but will loose their reference to this repeating transaction.
This can not be undone.

An empty account name is not possible
An account with this name already exists. Please choose a different one.
Balance at the beginning of this month:

Changing the balance at the beginning of the month will result in the automatic creation of a transaction in the previous month. This transaction will add or subtract the difference so that your desired balance for the current month is achieved.
Welcome to your privacy friendly Finance Manager. This app does not use any permissions.
You can manage your finances by tracking your earnings and expenses.

"You can create new transactions by clicking on the plus button in the main view. Now you are able to enter the amount, a title, a date and a category. Furthermore you can specify if the transaction is an expense or income. "
In the main view you are able to see the total balance of your transactions, as well as a list with all transactions you entered.

Under the menu item Categories you are able to see all the categories you created and their total balances, depending on the transactions that are labelled with the respective category. By clicking on the Plus-Button you can create new Categories.

In the accounts view you get an overview over all accounts. You can create new accounts by clicking the plus button. Every transaction is linked to one account and affects the total balance of this account. It can get quite difficult to synchronize the transactions of an account that exists in the real world with the transactions of the accountÂ´s virtual counterpart. In order to solve this issue the balance for the beginning of the month can be set for each account and each month.

Repeating transactions are transactions that are repeated automatically by the app. In addition to all the details you can set for a normal transaction for a repeating transaction you can set the end date and the repeating interval in weeks or months. The repeated transactions are then added at the beginning of the corresponding month or week.

All assigned transactions will be without category afterwards.
This can not be undone.

Are you sure you want to delete category %1$s?
Felix Hofmann, Leonard Otto, David Meiborg
You can not delete your last account.
